Dear Ms. Koziara:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 9/25/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4111 Job description
(1) An institution shall provide a job description for each
staff position that identifies rules, required
qualifications, and lines of authority.
Two of six new employee files reviewed lacked job descriptions.
Repeat Violation Establisted
2023 Interim Inspection, CAP Approved 10/2/2023

CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all
of the following information prior to employment or at
the time specified in this rule:
• (c) Verification of high school diploma or
GED when specified by rule.
One of six new employee files reviewed lacked verification of education.
Repeat Violation Establisted
2 023 Interim Inspection, CAP Approved 10/2/2023
CCI Rule 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers
(1) The licensee shall document, prior to employment,
that each employee and volunteer who has contact
with residents 4 or more hours per week for more than
2 consecutive weeks is free from communicable
tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable tuberculosis
shall be verified within the 1 year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the
last verification or prior to the expiration of the current
verification.
One of six new employee files reviewed lacked verification of Tuberculosis
screening.
Repeat Violation Establisted
2 023 Interim Inspection, CAP Approved 10/2/2023
CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
(2) The initial treatment plan developed by the social
worker shall document input from the resident, the
resident's parents, direct care staff, and the referral
source, unless documented as inappropriate.

Two of two current youth files reviewed lacked documentation to show input from
the resident, the resident's parents, direct care staff, and the referral source was
received unless documented as inappropriate in the initial treatment plan.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
(2) The updated treatment plan developed by the social
worker shall document input from the resident, the
resident's parents, direct care staff, and the referral
source, unless documented as inappropriate.
Two of two current youth files reviewed lacked documentation to show input from
the resident, the resident's parents, direct care staff, and the referral source was
received unless documented as inappropriate in the updated service plans.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
(4) The social service worker shall sign and date the
initial treatment plan.
One of two current youth files reviewed lacked the social service workers
signature.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility currently has a youth that has signed documentation stating refusal
of immunizations. The facility should continue to educate the youth on
immunizations and document attempts to offer immunizations to the youth on
an ongoing basis.
• Reminder that the facility must have quarterly fire drills on each shift.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation offered regarding training opportunities being made available to
first shift employees as per staff interviews many trainings occur during first
shift when employees are working and unable to attend the training.
• Consultation provided on placing screens on the house windows to prevent
bugs from coming in.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
• 2023 Interim Inspection: CAP was recording during this reporting period
as a result of the Interim Inspection completed 9/20/2023. The violations
were noted for employee personnel files, tuberculosis screenings for
employees, staff to resident ratio for varying interval room checks
exceeding fifteen minutes and staff training. The CAP contained action
items to ensure documents required for employee files were obtained
prior to hire by utilizing a checklist to confirm all required documents
were obtained. Per the current audit findings, there are repeat rule
violations for new employee files continuing to lack job descriptions,
education verification, and tuberculosis screening. The facility
implemented a system for human resources to email prompt sheet
reminders to supervisors a month prior to evaluations being completed
within the required timeframe. The facility reviewed expectations of
varying interval checks not to exceed fifteen minutes with all staff,
implemented supervisors review room check logs to ensure compliance
was being met. The facility ensured all staff were provided orientation
training for the specific facility as well as incorporated orientation for both
facilities into their new staff orientation.
• SIR2024C0001084, CAP approved 2/13/2024 was a result of violation
for Rule 400.4109 (1) (c) due to the facility not following their internal
policy and procedure for supervising youth as well as supervising youth
while on technology. The facility updated the internal supervision policy
and retrained staff regarding eyes on supervision and staffing ratio
expectations. The facility has ensured at least two staff are scheduled
at the facility for each shift outside normal business hours of the site
office to ensure staff to provide proper supervision.
Financial Overview
The facilities financial audit for 2023 was reviewed by Michigan Department of
Health & Human Services Bureau of Audit due to concerns noted in past audit
findings. A Management discission was sent to the facility on 9/10/2024. The
audit report included findings that MDHHS agrees are valid findings. The facility
stated corrective actions are adequate to address the findings. MDHHS will review
the facilities subsequent year audit report to confirm the findings are resolved. The
facilities financial audit and budget were reviewed during inspection.
PREA compliance (if applicable)

N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. Chief Administrator reported
findings in Interim inspection had a positive impact as the CAP assisted in
ensuring compliance for this Renewal inspection as the CAP provided a proactive
plan to review all documentation in order to obtain any missing or late submission
of documents. The facility has found the prompt sheets a useful tool to ensure
evaluations and treatment plans are coming due to ensure completion.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection. Staff reported feeling
supported by upper management, having all the required trainings to be successful
in their position, and no immediate concerns. Per interviews, the facility is
experiencing low staffing and is working to obtain more staff in order to elevate on
call supervisors having to fill shifts.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection. Youth reported feeling
safe and supported by staff at the facility. Youth reported all their needs are met at
the facility and no concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the facility was completed during the onsite inspection and no
safety concerns were noted. The facility was clean, medications and cleaning
supplies are being stored appropriately, and all bedrooms had appropriate
bedding.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
